member.name: T:System.Windows.Browser.BrowserInformation
member.summary: Provides general information about the browser, such as name, version, and operating system.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.BrowserInformation.BrowserVersion
member.summary: Gets the version of the browser technology that the current browser is based on.
member.returns: The version of the underlying browser technology.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.BrowserInformation.CookiesEnabled
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the browser supports cookies.
member.returns: true if the browser supports cookies; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.BrowserInformation.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the browser technology that the current browser is based on.
member.returns: The name of the underlying browser technology.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.BrowserInformation.Platform
member.summary: Gets the name of the browser's operating system.
member.returns: The name of the operating system the browser is running on.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.BrowserInformation.ProductName
member.summary: Gets the product name of the browser.
member.returns: The product name of the browser.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.BrowserInformation.ProductVersion
member.summary: Gets the product version number of the browser.
member.returns: The product version number of the browser.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.BrowserInformation.UserAgent
member.summary: Gets the browser's user agent string.
member.returns: The user agent string that identifies the browser.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlDocument
member.summary: Represents the HTML document in the browser.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlDocument.Body
member.summary: Gets a reference to the BODY element of the HTML document.
member.returns: The HTML document's BODY element.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlDocument.Cookies
member.summary: Gets or sets the browser's cookie string.
member.returns: The cookie string that is stored by the browser. If the browser does not have a cookie string, the property returns an empty string.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlDocument.CreateElement(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a browser element.
member.returns: A reference to a browser element.
member.param: The tag name of the browser element to create.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlDocument.DocumentElement
member.summary: Gets a reference to the browser's DOCUMENT element.
member.returns: The browser's DOCUMENT element.

member.name: E:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlDocument.DocumentReady
member.summary: Occurs when the browser page has completely loaded.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlDocument.DocumentUri
member.summary: Gets a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) object that represents the HTML document on which the Silverlight plug-in is hosted.
member.returns: The URI of the current HTML document.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlDocument.GetElementById(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a single browser element.
member.returns: A reference to a browser element.
member.param: A string identifier for a named browser element.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlDocument.GetElementsByTagName(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a collection of browser elements.
member.returns: A collection of references to HTML elements that correspond to the requested tag name.
member.param: A browser element's tag name.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlDocument.IsReady
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the browser has completely loaded the HTML page.
member.returns: true if the browser has completely loaded the HTML page that contains the Silverlight plug-in, the page has been fully parsed, and all Document Object Model (DOM) objects are available for programming; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlDocument.QueryString
member.summary: Gets a navigable, read-only collection of name/value pairs that represent the query string parameters on the current page's URL.
member.returns: The query string parameters on the current page's URL.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlDocument.Submit
member.summary: Posts user data from the FORM element in the browser's Document Object Model (DOM) to the server.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlDocument.Submit(System.String)
member.summary: Posts user data from the specified FORM element to the server.
member.param: The value of the attribute for an HTML FORM element.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlElement
member.summary: Represents an HTML element in the Document Object Model (DOM) of a Web page.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlElement.AppendChild(System.Windows.Browser.HtmlElement)
member.summary: Adds an element to the end of the child collection for the current HTML element.
member.param: The element to be added.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlElement.AppendChild(System.Windows.Browser.HtmlElement,System.Windows.Browser.HtmlElement)
member.summary: Adds an element at a specified location in the child element collection for the current HTML element.
member.param: The element to be added.
The location to insert the element. The element is added before .
member.exception: is not in the child element collection of the current HTML element.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlElement.Children
member.summary: Gets a read-only collection of HTML elements that are immediate descendants of the current HTML element.
member.returns: A collection of HTML elements. If the current HTML element has no children, the returned collection is empty.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlElement.CssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets the cascading style sheet (CSS) class string for the current HTML element.
member.returns: A CSS class string if the element is associated with a CSS class; otherwise, an empty string.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlElement.Focus
member.summary: Sets the browser focus to the current HTML element.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlElement.GetAttribute(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of the specified attribute on the current HTML element.
member.returns: An attribute on the current HTML element.
member.param: The name of an attribute.

member.summary: Retrieves the specified style attribute for the current HTML element.
member.returns: The style attribute for the current HTML element.
member.param: The name of the style attribute to retrieve.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlElement.Id
member.summary: Gets the identifier of the current HTML element.
member.returns: An HTML element ID string if the current element has an identifier; otherwise, an empty string.
member.exception: The property is set to an empty string.
The property is set to null.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlElement.Parent
member.summary: Gets a reference to the parent of the current HTML element.
member.returns: An HTML element reference if the element has a parent; otherwise, null.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlElement.RemoveAttribute(System.String)
member.summary: Removes an attribute from the current HTML element.
member.param: The name of the attribute to remove.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlElement.RemoveChild(System.Windows.Browser.HtmlElement)
member.summary: Removes the specified element from the child element collection of the current HTML element.
member.param: The element to remove.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlElement.RemoveStyleAttribute(System.String)
member.summary: Removes a style attribute on the current HTML element.
member.param: The style attribute to be removed.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlElement.SetAttribute(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the value of an attribute on the current HTML element.
member.param: The attribute whose value will be set.
The attribute's new value.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlElement.SetStyleAttribute(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the value of a style attribute on the current HTML element.
member.param: The style attribute whose value will be set.
The style attribute's new value.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlElement.TagName
member.summary: Gets the HTML tag name of the current HTML element.
member.returns: An HTML element tag name, such as div or span.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlEventArgs
member.summary: Provides event details to event handlers.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlEventArgs.AltKey
member.summary: Gets the state of the ALT key when the event was raised.
member.returns: true if the ALT key was pressed when the event was raised; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlEventArgs.CharacterCode
member.summary: Gets the integer Unicode value of a key that was pressed.
member.returns: An integer Unicode value of the key that was pressed if the property value is "keypress"; otherwise, 0 (zero).

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlEventArgs.ClientX
member.summary: Gets the x-coordinate mouse position in pixels relative to the client area of the window.
member.returns: The x-coordinate mouse position in pixels if the Document Object Model (DOM) event includes position information; otherwise, 0 (zero).

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlEventArgs.ClientY
member.summary: Gets the y-coordinate mouse position in pixels relative to the client area of the window.
member.returns: The y-coordinate mouse position in pixels if the Document Object Model (DOM) event includes position information; otherwise, 0 (zero).

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlEventArgs.CtrlKey
member.summary: Gets the state of the CTRL key when the event was raised.
member.returns: true if the CTRL key was pressed when the event was raised; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlEventArgs.EventObject
member.summary: Gets the underlying HTML event object.
member.returns: An HTML event object.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlEventArgs.EventType
member.summary: Gets the name of the event raised by the browser.
member.returns: An event name.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlEventArgs.KeyCode
member.summary: Gets the integer Unicode value of a key that is associated with a keyboard event other than "keypress".
member.returns: The integer Unicode value of a key involved in a keyboard event, if the event is not "keypress"; otherwise, 0 (zero).

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlEventArgs.MouseButton
member.summary: Gets the mouse buttons that were clicked at the time the event was raised.
member.returns: One of the enumeration values that indicates which mouse button was clicked.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlEventArgs.OffsetX
member.summary: Gets the x-coordinate mouse position in pixels relative to the HTML object that raised the event.
member.returns: The x-coordinate mouse position in pixels if the Document Object Model (DOM) event includes position information; otherwise, 0 (zero).

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlEventArgs.OffsetY
member.summary: Gets the y-coordinate mouse position in pixels relative to the HTML object that raised the event.
member.returns: The y-coordinate mouse position in pixels if the Document Object Model (DOM) event includes position information; otherwise, 0 (zero).

member.name: M:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlEventArgs.PreventDefault
member.summary: Specifies that the associated Document Object Model (DOM) element should not perform the default action for the current event.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlEventArgs.ScreenX
member.summary: Gets the x-coordinate mouse position in pixels relative to the user's screen.
member.returns: The x-coordinate mouse position in pixels if the Document Object Model (DOM) event includes position information; otherwise, 0 (zero).

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlEventArgs.ScreenY
member.summary: Gets the y-coordinate mouse position in pixels relative to the user's screen.
member.returns: The y-coordinate mouse position in pixels if the Document Object Model (DOM) event includes position information; otherwise, 0 (zero).

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlEventArgs.ShiftKey
member.summary: Gets the state of the SHIFT key when the event was raised.
member.returns: true if the SHIFT key was pressed when the event was raised; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlEventArgs.Source
member.summary: Gets a reference to the Document Object Model (DOM) element or object that raised the event.
member.returns: A reference to the DOM element or object that raised the event.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlEventArgs.StopPropagation
member.summary: Specifies that the event should not bubble up the Document Object Model (DOM) hierarchy.

member.summary: Attaches the specified .NET Framework event handler () to the specified event on the current Document Object Model (DOM) object.

member.param: A named event on the DOM object.
The method that handles the event.

member.summary: Converts the current object to a specified type. This method is not supported.
member.returns: None.
member.param: The conversion type.
true to allow JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) serialization; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Detaches the specified.NET Framework event handler () from the specified event on the current Document Object Model (DOM) object.
member.param: A named event on the DOM object.
The method that handles the event.

member.summary: Detaches the specified .NET Framework event handler () from the specified event on the current Document Object Model (DOM) object.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlPage
member.summary: Permits access to, and manipulation of, the browser's Document Object Model (DOM).

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlPage.BrowserInformation
member.summary: Gets general information about the browser, such as name, version, and operating system.
member.returns: An object that represents general information about the hosting browser.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlPage.Document
member.summary: Gets the browser's document object.
member.returns: A reference to the browser's document object.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlPage.IsEnabled
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the rest of the public surface area of the HTML Bridge feature is enabled.
member.returns: true if the HTML Bridge feature is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlPage.IsPopupWindowAllowed
member.summary: Indicates whether pop-up windows are allowed.
member.returns: true if pop-up windows are allowed; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlPage.Plugin
member.summary: Gets a reference to the Silverlight plug-in that is defined within an <object> or <embed> tag on the host HTML page.
member.returns: The Silverlight plug-in in the Document Object Model (DOM).

member.name: M:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlPage.PopupWindow(System.Uri,System.String,System.Windows.Browser.HtmlPopupWindowOptions)
member.summary: Opens a pop-up window.
member.returns: A handle to the new window; or null (see the Remarks section).
member.param: Specifies the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for the pop-up window.
Specifies the window that will be opened. (For more information, see the Remarks section.)
Specifies an object that controls the pop-up window. (For more information, see the Remarks section.)
member.exception: specifies a protocol other than http or https, such as file://, or a random URI moniker.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlPage.RegisterCreateableType(System.String,System.Type)
member.summary: Registers a managed type as available for creation from JavaScript code, through the Content.services.createObject and Content.services.createManagedObject helper methods.
member.param: The name used to register the managed type.
A managed type.
member.exception: is not public.-or- does not have a public, parameterless constructor.-or- is a string, primitive or value type, managed delegate, or empty string.-or- contains an embedded null character (\0).-or-An attempt is made to reregister

member.name: M:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlPage.RegisterScriptableObject(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Registers a managed object for scriptable access by JavaScript code.
member.param: The name used to register the managed object.
A managed object.
member.exception: An attempt is made to register a non-public type.-or- contains an embedded null character (\0).-or- has no scriptable entry points.-or-A property, method, or event that is marked as scriptable uses one of the following reserved names: addEventListener, removeEventListener, constructor, or createManagedObject.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlPage.UnregisterCreateableType(System.String)
member.summary: Explicitly unregisters a managed type that was previously registered by using the method.
member.param: The name of a registered managed type.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlPage.Window
member.summary: Gets the browser's window object.
member.returns: A reference to the browser's window object.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlPopupWindowOptions
member.summary: Provides options to control pop-up windows.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlPopupWindowOptions.Directories
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the Internet Explorer links toolbar or Firefox personal/bookmarks toolbar is shown in the pop-up window.
member.returns: true if Internet Explorer links toolbar or Firefox personal/bookmarks toolbar is shown in the pop-up window; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlPopupWindowOptions.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of a pop-up window.
member.returns: Height of the pop-up window, in pixels.
member.exception: The height is set to a value that is less than zero.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlPopupWindowOptions.Left
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the left edge of a pop-up window.
member.returns: Horizontal distance from the left edge of the browser's document space to the left edge of the pop-up window.
member.exception: The position is set to a value that is less than zero.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlPopupWindowOptions.Location
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL of a pop-up window.
member.returns: The URL of the pop-up window.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlPopupWindowOptions.Menubar
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the menu bar is visible in a pop-up window.
member.returns: true if the menu bar is visible in the pop-up window; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlPopupWindowOptions.Resizeable
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a pop-up window can be resized.
member.returns: true if the pop-up window can be resized; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlPopupWindowOptions.Scrollbars
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether scroll bars are visible in a pop-up window.
member.returns: true if scroll bars may appear in the pop-up window; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlPopupWindowOptions.Status
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the status bar is visible in a pop-up window.
member.returns: true if the status bar is visible in the pop-up window; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlPopupWindowOptions.Toolbar
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the toolbar is visible in a pop-up window.
member.returns: true if the toolbar is visible in the pop-up window; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlPopupWindowOptions.Top
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the top edge of a pop-up window.
member.returns: Vertical distance from the top edge of the browser's document space to the top edge of the pop-up window.
member.exception: The position is set to a value that is less than zero.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlPopupWindowOptions.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of a pop-up window.
member.returns: Width of the pop-up window, in pixels.
member.exception: The width is set to a value that is less than zero.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlWindow
member.summary: Provides the managed representation of the JavaScript window object.

member.summary: Displays a dialog box that contains an application-defined message.

member.summary: Displays a confirmation dialog box that contains an optional message as well as OK and Cancel buttons.
member.returns: true if the user clicked the OK button; otherwise, false.
member.param: The text to display.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlWindow.CreateInstance(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates an instance of the specified JavaScript type.
member.returns: A JavaScript type.
member.param: An HTML tag name.
Creation parameters.
member.exception: is an empty string or cannot be resolved.-or-There is a type mismatch between one of the supplied creation parameters and the target parameter(s).

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlWindow.CurrentBookmark
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that represents the hash value of the current page's URL.
member.returns: The hash value of the current page's URL. If the URL has no hash value, this property returns an empty string.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Browser.HtmlWindow.Eval(System.String)
member.summary: Evaluates a string that contains arbitrary JavaScript code.
member.returns: The results of the JavaScript engine's evaluation of the string in the parameter.
member.param: JavaScript code.

member.returns: A reference to the underlying window object that represents the new browser.
member.param: The URL of the page to open.
The name of the window or tab that should be opened in.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Browser.ScriptableMemberAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a specific property, method, or event is accessible to JavaScript callers.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.ScriptableMemberAttribute.EnableCreateableTypes
member.summary: Controls the generation of Silverlight plug-in helper methods that can be used to create wrappers around managed objects.
member.returns: true if the HTML bridge feature should automatically generate helper methods in the scope of the registered scriptable type; otherwise, false. The default is true.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.ScriptableMemberAttribute.ScriptAlias
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of a property, method, or event that is exposed to JavaScript code. By default, the script alias is the same as the name of the managed property, method, or event.
member.returns: The name of a property, method, or event.
member.exception: The alias is set to an empty string.
The alias is set to null.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Browser.ScriptableTypeAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that all public properties, methods, and events on a managed type are available to JavaScript code when they are registered by using the method.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Browser.ScriptEventHandler
member.summary: Gets a reference to the JavaScript object that raised the event.
member.param: A reference to the JavaScript object that raised the event.
A reference to the complex type that is passed as an event argument.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Browser.ScriptObject
member.summary: Defines the core behavior for the class, and provides a base class for browser Document Object Model (DOM) access types.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Browser.ScriptObject.CheckAccess
member.summary: Determines whether the current thread is the browser's UI thread.
member.returns: true if the current thread is the browser's UI thread; false if it is a background thread.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Browser.ScriptObject.ConvertTo``1
member.summary: Converts the current scriptable object to a specified type.
member.returns: An object of type .
member.typeparam: The type to convert the current scriptable object to.
member.exception: The conversion failed or is not supported.

member.summary: Converts the current scriptable object to a specified type, with serialization support.
member.returns: An object of type .
member.param: The type to convert the current scriptable object to.
A flag which enables the current scriptable object to be serialized.
member.exception: The conversion failed or is not supported.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Browser.ScriptObject.Dispatcher
member.summary: Gets an instance of the dispatcher.
member.returns: The dispatcher associated with the user interface (UI) thread.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Browser.ScriptObject.Finalize
member.summary: Frees resources and performs other cleanup operations before the scriptable object is reclaimed by garbage collection.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Browser.ScriptObject.GetProperty(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the value of a property that is identified by ordinal number on the current scriptable object.
member.returns: A null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if the property does not exist or if the underlying is a managed type.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Browser.ScriptObject.GetProperty(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of a property that is identified by name on the current scriptable object.
member.returns: A null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if the property does not exist or if the underlying is a managed type.
member.param: The name of the property.
member.exception: is an empty string.-or- contains an embedded null character (\0).

member.name: M:System.Windows.Browser.ScriptObject.Initialize(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a scriptable object.
member.param: The handle to the object to initialize.
The identity of the object.
true to specify that the HTML Bridge should assign a reference count to this object; otherwise, false.
true to release the reference on dispose; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Browser.ScriptObject.Invoke(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Invokes a method on the current scriptable object, and optionally passes in one or more method parameters.
member.returns: An object that represents the return value from the underlying JavaScript method.

member.exception: is an empty string.-or- contains an embedded null character (\0).-or-The method does not exist or is not scriptable.
